children.subject: Thank you so much for the suggestions. Since I have only a few friends who are CS major, I have little knowledge on what UD courses have to offer. I will definitely look into the options that you suggested. Btw, since you recommend Prof Hug's lectures, where can I watch them??
https://sp21.datastructur.es How dare you not know where to find Hug’s lectures. PS if you want to audit read the audit section on how to join their gradescope for auditors.

I would discourage you from taking 61B. I'm sure you would be able to take it (it might not count for credit though), and it would not affect your declaration after you've already declared unless you are trying to wait until finishing 61B to declare. However, there are so many great upper div EE and CS classes that taking one of those technicals would give you far more benefit than retaking 61B. If you really want the world class experience, you get basically all of it by watching Hug's lectures on your own time, which can be done over a summer or winter break. If you are really concerned about your software engineering skills because you didn't subject yourselves to gitlet,, simply take CS 169, as it will give you much more design principles than 61B ever will. Even if you really can't find a good CS UD to take, take something from another department. Learning how to design and manufacture things from Design Innovation or brushing up on Math would probably be a far better use of your time.

history.content: This is a good question for the CS advising team, cs-advising@cs.berkeley.edu because the answer will depend on your grades in 61A and 70. If you want to take 61B to improve your GPA for declaration, you can take it again at Berkeley. If you have already applied to declare and you have a good enough GPA, it wouldn't change anything. Then I think there are the points that Anon Poet makes.

Hi I am a junior transfer student and since I took an equivalent course to the 61B from my previous college, I took 61A and 70 this semester and submitted CS major declaration form. But I heard 61B at Cal is really great, and I am thinking about taking it.

1. Is it possible that I take the course in my situation ?

2. If I decide to take it, does it affect my CS major application process?
history.subject: Can I take cs61b in my situation?
